medical_history.chief_complaint: Right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain radiating to the back.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The RUQ pain began suddenly without a clear trigger around 2 days prior to the presentation. It quickly worsened to severe stabbing and constant pain, worst in the RUQ, radiating to the right back/flank and groin. Nothing seemingly alleviates or exacerbates the pain including eating, deep breathing, coughing, and position changes. The patient also experienced nausea and has vomited twice since the onset of pain, with the vomit mainly containing food.
medical_history.past_medical_history: T2DM, cholelithiasis, hyperlipidemia (HLD), hypertension (HTN), asthma, sleep apnea, chronic pain, depression, and morbid obesity.
